intro: Hieracium cernuatum, commonly known as the drooping hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, with ray florets that are shorter than the disk florets. Hieracium cernuatum thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
